The documents, primarily from 1975, summarize testimonies and recollections of FBI Special Agent Alan G. Sentinella before the Senate Select Committee (SSC). These investigations focused on alleged communist ties and electronic surveillance related to King and his associates. O'Dell's significance appears to stem from his potential association with individuals or groups suspected of communist affiliations, which was a key focus of the FBI's scrutiny during this period. The documents highlight the FBI's efforts to provide information to the SSC regarding these connections.
